content:
-2 -
Regarding Recommendation (2) - During a period about one year ago, sizable quantities of excess supplies which had not been requested or were in excess of the requested quantities were shipped from USA under PIO/C 00043 and PIO/C 80450, the procurement agency of both PIO/C's being GSA/TSS/FUU. Efforts have continuously been made to utilize these unexpected arrivals to the best advantage. Major portion has thus been allocated or sold though there is still a small portion remains in BES yard and is being under sale by CTC. The quantities of unsold items have been considerably reduced through months of afforts by relevant offices.
Regarding Recommendation (3) - The storage condition at BES yard has been improved where practicable. as the excess equipment are stored in BES yard only for a short period and consist mainly of heavy construction equipment which can stand weathering, no construction of warehouse for their storage is ever contemplated.
Regarding Recommendation (4) . For the Non-Project Excess Property, only few items of Domestic Excess Property procured under PA's 0230 and 1206 were sold to traders and privato individuals. These items had been put to auction but no industrial end-users had participated in the bid. In order to have the acquired properties disposed of as quick as possible and to generate some NT dollars to meet local expenses already incurred, these few items were awarded to the traders who were the successful bidders. Since then the stipulations of "Special Provisions" in PÅ 0220 were observed and adhered to without fail. It was immediately after receipt of the said Audit Report that attention of both CTC and TSB has been called te sot allowing any more traders and individuals to participate in the bids of excess properties. We shall appreciate having your con- currence in all the transactions as referred to above.
51. 3. 100×200

(2) 218 Academia Historieaf
D
